chapter.title: Installing &caasp; &o_orch; Templates
chapter.para: This chapter describes how to install &caasp; &o_orch; template on &productname;.

section.title: &caasp; &o_orch; Installation Procedure

step.para: Download the latest &caasp; (CaaSP) for &ostack; image (for example, SUSE-CaaS-Platform-3.0-OpenStack-Cloud.x86_64-1.0.0-GM.qcow2) from .
Upload the image to &o_img;:
step.screen: openstack image create --public --disk-format qcow2 --container-format \ bare --file SUSE-CaaS-Platform-3.0-OpenStack-Cloud.x86_64-1.0.0-GM.qcow2 \ CaaSP-3

step.para: Install the caasp-openstack-heat-templates package on a machine with &productname; repositories:
The installed templates are located in /usr/share/caasp-openstack-heat-templates.
Alternatively, you can get official &o_orch; templates by cloning the appropriate Git repository:
In &o_dash;, go to ProjectStacksLaunch Stack.
Select File from the Template Source drop-down box and upload the caasp-stack.yaml file.
In the Launch Stack dialog, provide the required information (stack name, password, flavor size, external network of your environment, etc.).

Click Launch to launch the stack. This creates all required resources for running &caasp; in an &ostack; environment. The stack creates one &admnode;, one &masternode;, and server worker nodes as specified.

procedure.title: Install Templates from the Command Line

step.para: Specify the appropriate flavor and network settings in the caasp-environment.yaml file.
Create a stack in &o_orch; by passing the template, environment file, and parameters:
step.screen: openstack stack create -t caasp-stack.yaml -e caasp-environment.yaml \ --parameter image=CaaSP-3 caasp-stack

step.para: After the stack has been created, the &caasp_dash; runs on the &admnode;. You can access it using the &admnode;'s floating IP address.
Create an account and follow the steps in the &caasp_dash; to complete the &caasp; installation.

section.para: When you have successfully accessed the admin node web interface via the floating IP, follow the instructions at to continue the setup of &caasp;.

section.title: Installing &caasp; with Multiple Masters

note.para: A &o_orch; stack with load balancing and multiple master nodes can only be created from the command line, because &o_dash; does not have support for nested &o_orch; templates.

section.para: Install the caasp-openstack-heat-templates package on a machine with &productname; repositories:
The installed templates are located in /usr/share/caasp-openstack-heat-templates.
A working load balancer is needed in your &cloud; deployment. Two load balancer providers are available: Octavia and HAProxy.
Verify that load balancing with Octavia or HAProxy is working correctly in your &ostack; installation by creating a load balancer manually and checking that the provisioning_status changes to Active.
section.screen: &prompt.ardana;neutron lbaas-loadbalancer-create --name test-lb --provider octavia <SUBNET_ID> OR &prompt.ardana;neutron lbaas-loadbalancer-create --name test-lb --provider haproxy <SUBNET_ID>
section.para: Octavia is the default load balancer provider in &productname; It has some prerequisites for its installation such as the availability of an amphora image in &o_img;.

The steps below can be used to set up a network, subnet, router, security and IPs for a test lb_net1 network with lb_subnet1 subnet. If you use this setup for verifying load balancer in the example above, please set lb_subnet1 as <SUBNET_ID> in the neutron lbaas-loadbalancer-create commands.
section.screen: &prompt.ardana;openstack network create lb_net1 &prompt.ardana;openstack subnet create --name lb_subnet1 lb_net1 \ --subnet-range 172.29.0.0/24 --gateway 172.29.0.2 &prompt.ardana;openstack router create lb_router1 &prompt.ardana;openstack router add subnet lb_router1 lb_subnet1 &prompt.ardana;openstack router set lb_router1 --external-gateway ext-net &prompt.ardana;openstack network list

procedure.title: Steps to Install &caasp; with Multiple Masters

step.para: Specify the appropriate flavor and network settings in the caasp-multi-master-environment.yaml file.
Set master_count to the desired number in the caasp-multi-master-environment.yaml file. The master count must be set to an odd number of nodes.
Create a stack in &o_orch; by passing the template, environment file, and parameters:
step.screen: &prompt.ardana;openstack stack create -t caasp-multi-master-stack.yaml \ -e caasp-multi-master-environment.yaml --parameter image=CaaSP-3 caasp-multi-master-stack

step.para: Find the floating IP address of the load balancer. This is necessary for accessing the Velum &caasp; dashboard.
From the output, copy the id and enter it in the following command as shown in the following example:
Search the floating IP list for vip_address
step.screen: &prompt.ardana;openstack floating ip list | grep 172.28.0.6 | d636f3...481b0c | fd7ff...deb4c1 | 172.28.0.6 | 10.84.65.37 | 53ad2...373e8b |

step.para: The load balancer floating ip address is 10.84.65.37

section.para: After the stack has been created, the Velum &caasp; dashboard runs on the Admin Node. You can access it using the floating IP address of the Admin Node.
Create an account and follow the steps in the Velum &caasp; dashboard to complete the &caasp; installation.

section.title: Deploy CaaSP Stack Using &o_orch; CaaSP Playbook

step.para: Install the caasp-openstack-heat-templates package on a machine with &productname; repositories:
The installed templates are located in /usr/share/caasp-openstack-heat-templates.
Run heat-caasp-deploy.yml on the &lcm; to create a CaaSP cluster with &o_orch; templates from the caasp-openstack-heat-templates package.
In a browser, navigate to the &o_dash; UI to determine the floating IP address assigned to the admin node.
Go to http://ADMIN-NODE-FLOATING-IP/ to bring up the Velum dashboard.
Follow the steps for bootstrap and add nodes to the cluster to bring up the CaaSP Kubernetes cluster.

section.title: Deploy CaaSP Cluster with Multiple Masters Using &o_orch; CaasP Playbook

step.para: Install the caasp-openstack-heat-templates package on a machine with &productname; repositories:
The installed templates are located in /usr/share/caasp-openstack-heat-templates.
On the &lcm;, run the heat-caasp-deploy.yml playbook and pass parameters for caasp_stack_name, caasp_stack_yaml_file and caasp_stack_env_yaml_file.
